I did however get two of them.  Nothing special in the beer, but it was pleasant to drink.  It was too expensive however, but not bad.

Bottle. Nice dark copper body with average carbonation and diminishing brown bubbly head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with brown sugar and caramel notes. Well balanced taste, slightly dominated by hoppiness. Ends with a fairly bittersweet finish. This goes beyond my expectations. Not bad.

10apr06 six bottles for $9.  Nine dollars for six beers and I was ripped off.  I don’t like regular heine, but this tastes better that regular.  fruity aroma and taste that lasts just about till the finish.

The bottle poured a crystal clear deep ruby colored beverage with a medium sized white smooth head that didn’t last very long and left no lacing on the glass The aroma was dominated by the sweet smell of very ripe banana. There seemed to be slight notes of roasted malt as well. The body was medium with average carbonation and a watery texture. This one is just a step above a lawn mower beer. The flavor starts off sweet and stays that way throughout the average length finish. There is a slight alcohol warmth in the finish.
I’m not a huge fan of the standard Heineken beer, but I found this brew above acceptable.
Pours almost like a st. pauli girl dark.  Aroma was not very almost like a regular heineken but with some garbage thrown in.  Flavor was drinkable but not enjoyable.  This needs a re-brew.
Dark red-brown color with a light tan head.  This beer has a nice sweet flavor with some malty aftertaste.

3/5/06: Bottle.
Medium-deep red-brown body with a thick quickly dissipating head.  Tan lace.  Aroma is sweet and malty with a hint of molasses.  Flavor is malty with brown sugar.  Thin, slightly bitter finish.
Dark brown color with some malty aroma.  The taste was surprisingly good with some malty chocolate tones in there.  I really don’t like regular Heineken, but this was good.

Pours near black with ruby hues and a fully receding tan head. Aroma of birch wood, caramel, brown sugar, and rising dough. Taste is light chocolate, dusty yeast, toasted bread, and slight metallic bitterness from the herbal hops. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with soft, moderate carbonation. Not so watery as to be unpleasant. I’m actually impressed, this is pretty good for a macro. Not all Heineken is skunked.

bottle - Pours dark reddish-brown with a medium head that fades away after a few minutes.  No lacing.  The aroma is light and of roast malt.  It has a taste to match.  There’s very little hops flavor.  This is an okay beer, but it’s too thin and could used hopped up a bit.
This actually isn’t all bad. Decent appearance. For a lager, the initilal flavor is okay, a little chocolaty. The flat lager taste comes through in the end, but better than expected.

Bottle. Pours deep burgundy red with a tiny head that quickly dissipates. Mildly sweet malts tasted all the way through with little bitterness and very short aftertaste. Some toffee. Thin body and not much flavor -- feels watered down. A lot better than the regular lager and a pleasant beer to drink but nothing exceptional.
I’m not a fan at all of Heineken, but the dark version of the namesake is very good.  Clean drinking, and smooth, I found it very refreshing.
Clear brown, no head. Sweet caramel malt aroma with a hint of coffee. Medium bodied, a bit sweet, some toffee and coffee note maybe a hint of root beer.

Aroma is brisk with caramel and malt and has a metal background. Hue is a burgundy red and there was no head created. Flavor is semi-sweet with minor notes of caramel, sugar, and toffee. First time having this beer even though ive seen it on the shelf for the last five years and always said i would try it one day.
Pours a deep dark goldish brown color.  Aromas of rich malts with a touch of hops.  Malt flavor with a malty finish and aftertaste.
A browish colour and medium bitterness. Doesn’t effect the palate in a way I would have expected. This isn’t a Guiness, this is a watery stout.
long finish, and rather pungent upon drinking. This beer is at the bottom of my list.
this was an absolute drain pour brew. it was nice and dark in color but thats about all it had going for it. it makes you feel like you have a suit made of fire ants on.

Reddish brown lager which overflowed of my bottle, yield a thick compact moka head in the glass, collapsing to oblivion. Some of this will remain on my carpet until next wash. Sweet caramel and wet dog hair in aroma. In mouth, nutty caramel in mouth, with very little body, short aftertaste, some metallic hops slightly noted. Watery and boring. Bought in Potsdam, NY, 6 months ago, for 1$.

Bottled, 330ml, pasteurised. Dark brown, reddish with gassed head. A beer with a boiled veg background and a sweet body, quite watery on the palate. There is a maize like quality in the flavour and tart finish. Not my sort of beer.
bottle.  Poured deep brown with medium large bubble head.  Aroma was weak but malty as was the flavor. It was ok but very watered down.

bottle. very dark with a light brown head. not much of an aroma. slight burnt taste. i like this better than the regular heineken, but not as tasty as some better amber lagers. decent beer thats easy to drink.
Dark mahogany beer with a small tan head that is soon gone.  Aroma of sweet dark malts.  Taste is mild and malty, and a bit of sour molasses.  Not bad for swill.
It’s like they took their pale lager and added food coloring to it. I can’t really tell the difference.
(Bottle)  Pours a medium brown body with a moderate light beige head.  Malty and caramel qualiities in the nose and taste.

There was not a whole lot going on in this beer.  Only marginally more interesting than normal Heineken.  I don’t know why I even bothered with this beer.  Argh.  I enjoyed the Sam Adams Vienna much more.  The one redeeming part about tasting this beer was that I don’t think it’s that widely distributed in the US.  At least I hadn’t seen in before.  So there.
Burgandy in color.  Small head with good lacing.  Flavor is full of malt and roast.  Alright on the palate.  Lacks that extra ummph to make it a great beer, but pretty good.
Pours a ruby color with small tan head.  Aroma is very malty. Some sweetness. Roasty. Dry,biter finish.  A pleasant suprise from Heinkein.

Bottle.  Deep maroon-brown hue with a short lived fizzy tan head.  Very filtered-clear.  Heavily toasted dark bread, lightly salted buttered popcorn, pure malt sweetness, flowers, grain.  Sort of misses the Vienna mark for me with the popcorn bit.  Moderatley sweet, lightly acidic flavor.  Lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter finish.  Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.  Very light raisin sweetness in the aftertaste.  Uneventful and over carbonated.

(12 oz bottle: Dick’s Liquor in La Jolla, CA) I used to drink this with some regularity years ago, but it’s been quite some time since my last bottle.  Mostly because, well, there’s much better beer out there.  The very sweet and very caramely aroma smells cheap and sugary.  The flavor isn’t much different: very sweet, sugary, caramely, it tastes like some processed sugar product, but there’s a decent flavor of drying toastiness emerging in the finish that helps to offset the sugary sweetness, but only slightly.  Medium bodied, nearly cloying in the finish.  There’s a very ruddy tint to the brown color, and clarity is perfect.  The light-tan head pours to an inch, but gradually falls away, leaving just a hatless body of liquid with no lacing to decorate the glass.  Yeah, now I remember why I don’t drink this beer anymore; I like sweet beers, but this is not a quality sweetness.

I understand why not that many people have rated this beer, after experienceing the poor quality of regular heineken would not lead one to believe they were getting a quality product from heineken dark.  It is, however, a fairly decent dark lager, nice and sweet, roasted malts and a pleasant appearnace.  This beer goes down smooth, no bitterness.  Quite enjoyable.

Sweet malty aroma with a hint of caramel and bubble gum. Deep brown with a thin head. Big caramel malt fore with hints of brown sugar and molasses. Sort of raisiny finish. Remarkably flavorful for a Heine.

This is a very good beer.  Much better than the original heineken.  The color is very nice dark brown.  and the head is a pretty tint brown color.  The body of the beer is more thin than expected, or than I like.  The smell and flavor are very nice as well.  Hops, malt, and roast in a great combination.  A very good beer for dark beer fans who want something in mass quantities.
Bottle. Nice dark woody color. Much better then regular Heineken lager. Smells a little skunky and doesn’t have a wonderful taste, but its still an honest beer.

Bottle. Pours a nice mahogany color with a whitish head. However, the appearance is the best thing about it. Smells like malted skunk. Watery palate. A bit of malt flavor, but mostly corn and nastiness. Tastes like a carbonated tepid pond. Gross, but better than regular Heiny.

bottle. This pours surprisingly okay. Nice rich red hue, but no head after a few seconds of pouring. The aroma was the worst thing about this beer, it’s skunk with some malt under it. The taste is nearly tolerable with actual discernable malts. Still, there’s a very unsettling artificial corn taste to it. This is better than regular heineken at least.

light cola brown with ruby highlights. A fairly modest head sticks initially but dissapates after a couple of sips to near nothingness. The lack of lacing was quite disappointing. rich, sweet malt with caramel. A mild, bitter roastiness also pulls through. Rather one-dimensional, but somewhat enjoyable and better than average. A moderate balance of sweet caramel malt and roasted malt character are complemented by a very mild bitterness for a fairly dry finish. Through retro-olfaction, a thin sweet wine taste presents itself. A very simple flavor that is mildly sweet and roasty. Too thin and not very complex, but satisfactory. thin and a little flat. Needs more carbonation to make the mouthfeel more lively to compensate for the rather weak flavor. Oh, I have drunk my share of Heineken Dark when I was in the mood for a simple session brew. Of course there are much better session brews out there, but a good micro session brew is hard to find around New Orleans. This is an average beer that doesn’t taste bad, but certainly does not impress. This is just a beer that I kill time with friends with and it hasn’t let me down. If better microbrews were available, I would drink them, but there aren’t many choices in New Orleans apart from Martin’s Wine Cellar. In short, Heineken Dark is a beer I sometimes choose to have and will never turn down.
Pretty bad.  A bad atempt at beer in general,  mettalic, unbalanced.  Just a crap beer.
Good beer, much better than regular heineken.  Finishes strong and makes me feel manly.

bottle- euro dark lager (dunkel?)
aroma has a root beer candy, molassas, brown sugar aroma. Well carbonated. sweet flavor
This is one great beer with the exception of not pouring thick.  It is very thin.  Looks good, tastes great, pours like a macro lite.
Drink this one the PINT-festival at the Koningshoeve abbey. This is a good Dark lager with a lightly bitter taste with hints of caramel.

This is kinda interesting.  It has a watery bent, with hints of cinnamon.  Go figure.  Not bad.

Re-rate:

2008 Bottle.  A cheaply produced American dunkel.  Aroma of roasted malts.  Appearance is like freshly poured Coca-Cola; head quickly dissipates leaving a light cream lacing on the glass with a deep, dark complexion to the beer.  Tastes of dark malts with a watery aftertate and palate.  Overall, not that great.

pours a dark reddish brown with a decent tan head, the aroma is of sweet malts, yeast, & corn, taste was sweet and bready, ok body an ok drinakable beer, but nothing great.
Earlier Rating: 7/18/2005 Total Score: 2.5
pours a translucent mahogany with a decent off-white to light tan head, aroma is of sweet malts and maybe a little spice, the taste is sweet, malty, a little bitter and dry, a smooth brown sugar finish, not a bad beer.

This one is kept from being great mostly due to the fact that its thin and has a metallic finish. Otherwise, this beer is very nice. The aroma has a robust caramel character. Color is an attractive dark chocolate brown but the head is average at best and fades fast. The flavor has a lot of those toasted caramel malts and a short bitterness. The good part about the aftertaste is the toasted bread flavor. Overall a much better beer than the original.

A Heineken with a crown top?  Craziness.  Pours a clear mahogany with a lasting tan head.  Sugary sweet brown malt aroma.  The flavor is more bitter featuring drier, less sweet brown malt (still nothing exciting) and anise.  Dry overall.

Pour is a very dark brown with a white head. Aroma is hard to find but i do get some malty qualities after i let it warm up.  Flavor is malty but rather bland.  Nothing really going on here but i did not expect much.

Pours a four-finger light tan head that fades quickly leaving no lace.  Clear deep amber color.  Medium bodied and very light carbonation.  Sweet malty nose.  Starts sweet finish is like a dry root beer.  Better than their lager.  $1.45 for a 12oz. bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.
A deep dark brown with hint of ruby.  Malty aroma to the beer.  Not much hop flavor but has a mild malt bitterness.
This is better than regular heineken, but it still is just a pretty bad beer. It reminds me of newcaste.
I guess if I needed proof that dark doesn’t mean it’s better, this is it. I love my cookie dough with bits of metal and candy hearts in it.
sweet, doughy, metallic nose; simple, grainy, dull, sweet flavor, soy sauce hints and a slightly dry finish; watery and a little astringent with unpleasant, tinny flavors; pretty bad

Pours a transparent, overly carbonated deep ruby/brown, rapidly diminishing whtie foamy head.  Aroma is roasted malts and caramel.    Flavor is slightly spicy roasted malts.  Very light and watery mouthfeel.

Shared a 6-pack in a Vegas hotel room while doing a training class project. Lasting ring of foam. Dark red copper. Rich malt aroma with prunes and spices. Airy spiciness in the mouth. Light mild flavour. Brings to mind ginger cookies. A browned sugar finish.
It poured from the bottle with a nice, frothy head.  The aroma has dark roasted malt, I detect a little caramel.  It uses the same hop variety as regular Heineken.  The finish is smooth.  Very good.

Bottle.  Mahogany, average head.  The word of the day is, "caramel".  Lots of it with some maltiness.  I wish more companies would do dark lagers like this than pilsners; they’re harder to screw up and they have way better shelf life.  Roasted almond hints, plastic-ish aftertaste.  Oily mouthfeel and texture.  Better than regular Heiney.

Pours a deep ruby/brownish color. Aroma is of caramel and an artificial smelling roastiness. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy. Moderate roasty bitterness. Very good for a Heineken product I think.  Certainly drinkable.
Minimal head, reddish coffee brown color, slightly malty aroma, well-balanced but quite bland taste, hops flavor only an afterthought, medium-bodied and pretty well-carbonated, nothing special

Pours a dark deep red with initially frothy brown head that diminishes to a very thin layer. Almost no aroma at all, some malt and metal. Flavor is malt, burnt flavors a little and caramel (burnt sugar) with a very lightly hopped roasty finish. Very thin bodied. Easy drinking but a poorly blanced beer. Almost artificial in it’s flavor although it is far superior to the regular stuff. Must be that green bottle causing mayhem with the beer, or maybe the beer just was not very good to begin with. I’d take this over quite a few crappy beers.

Poured dark ruby red, almost black with a good head.
Aroma was malty with a touch of roast.
Flavor is a bit watery but good. Light roast and malt with a bit of a metalic finish.
Skunky but with a ok chocolate flavor.  trying to take the same beer and adding to it?

Poured dark wth a small fizzy off-white head.  Aroma of pale hops and chocolate notes.  Taste follows from aroma, with corn and chocolate... tastes literally like regular heineken with chocolate malt.  Unimpressive.
nasty dark beer not one the better darks that you can buy i bought one of these and wanted to puke after i drank it terrible aftertaste and not a very good beer

from the bottle. poured a dark amber with a light tan head. aroma, malts some sweetness, almost brown sugur almost white, a roasted nut . not a whole lot going on with this one, got hints of malts and hops, some sweetness, and a dry mouth feel.

Poured a dark amber color.  Nice color.  I smell a slight sweetness with a hint of a burnt smell.  With the first sip I get a burnt, roasted taste...some sweetness. I would say that the strongest taste is the roasted malt taste that leaves a somewhat lingering aftertaste.  It reminds me a LOT of Warsteiner, a dunkel, and I agree with TChrome that it also reminds me of a Marzen.  It’s not bad.  Definitely drinkable.  I like this if I’m out with friends standing around a bon fire, but not if I’m wanting to taste the intracies of a brew.  Not a bad brew at all, just not outstanding I don’t guess.
It somehow manages to maintain an underlying Henieken skunkiness but add enough real beer maltiness to make it palatable.
a bit darker in color, and a bit maltier and tastier than its brother.  but not by much.

Pours a clean mahagoney with an average frothy light brown head that diminishes slightly and then becomes a little rocky and leaving spotty lacing.  Brown sugar and caramel malt aroma with yeast notes and a faint hop nose.  Buttery malt flavor with brown sugar and ends with a slight hoppiness.  Medium-bodied fizzy palate.
Pours a nice looking deep garnet with an overflowing head.  Aroma is malty and sweet.  Flavor is mostly sweet and dry, very thin but not unpleasant.  This isn’t bad coming from a swill brewer!

Poured an amber brown color with fizzy white head.  Sweet malty aroma that I found pleasant.  Flavor is a little watery, but generally nicely malty and syrupy and sweet. Definitely much better than regular Heineken.  Overall, I found it surprisingly enjoyable.  I could kick back a few of these...maybe I will.

bottle. poured a reddish brown with a white head that did not last well, but laced a little. very malt dominated character...syrupy...boring but not bad..better than the green label Heineken. I don’t think I’ll get this again.

bottle.  Nice amber color, with thin white head that fades off quickly.  Aroma of malt and taste of malt.  Ordinary beer but better than the lager.  


Biere dèun brun rouge fonce avec un mince collet blanc qui disparait rapidement.  odeur et gout de malt, sans plus, tres ordinaire mais meilleur que la lager qui est vendu ici.

Nice amber color,small off white head that faded slowly leaving a slight lace behind.The aroma was malty with a slight sweet side and a bit of hops,and maybe a slight caramel side coming through as well.The flavor is mildly malty with a bit od caramel and hops and a bit thin bodied.Not bad but could definately be better then it is.It’s worth a try but little mroe then that.
Earlier Rating: 12/17/2002 Total Score: 2.5
Run of the mill nothing special brew.Lite malt aroma with the same in the flavor,little after taste that was bitter could be just a old 6-pack but i think there always this way, better to stay with reg.Heineken

This one exceeded my expectations as I am not a big fan of the green bottle Heineken.  Pours up very nicely with good amber and a well retained beige colored head.  Aroma is a bit on the bland side, a bit dusty, and a hint of corn, also a faint malty, nutty note as well.  Flavor slightly resembles a weak Marzen.  Sweet, nutty with a touch of caramel.  Not a bad beer.

Surprised to see only 14 ratings here, so I checked out Heineken’s website to see what their excuse for this dribble was.  Wouldn’t you know it, a company this large can’t keep its site working properly.  It pours a headless reddish brown and has a LIGHT roasted malt aroma with hints of caramel sweetness.  There’s really not much body or taste to comment on, honestly, but it does have a nasty, rusty finish.  If they’re not going to fix their website, they should use all of their money to produce a decent beer for a change.

Bottle. Dark garnet bottle. I have always wondered what a "dark" BMC would taste like. Now I know. Thin, cardboard, metallic, grape, medium malts, dirty aftertaste. Not a particular bad beer. But seriously, if the average home brewer had the money and resources of Heineken, we would produce a much better product.

didn’t know this was a different beer myself, really smooth and malty.  Had a biter aftertaste which was too minmal to be unpleasant.  Brown in color with a thin white head.  It was missing body though. 
Earlier Rating: 11/22/2002 Total Score: 3.7
not my fav''s when it comes too dark beer, but it s worth the price.

Bottled: Dark is definately the right word. Very deep brown color is darker than the bottle it comes in. Smells a little better than it’s un-dark cousin, but loses slightly in the taste and palate departments. It’s something to get if you want Heineken but they’re out of the green stuff.
One of the first ’dark’ beers I ever had, this one is pretty good.  Has a weird molasses-like finish, but it’s nothing heavy.   A lighter dark, but one that is worth revisiting.
What is really going on here?  Heineken dark?  Heineken just needs to stop really.  Not super bad, marginally better than regular Heineken.  Drink again?  Not at all.

Poured  dark, light malt aroma, few flavors. Taste like it was processed yill nothing was left.
Earlier Rating: 11/25/2004 Total Score: 3
This is much better. I have had this before I dicovered real brew.  I loved it then, I liked iy now. Ok for a dark beer, but nothing out of the ordinary.

not very thick for a dark beer. has the light refreshing quality of regular heineken, but not the deep hoppy or nutty flavor that i expected from a dark beer. barely above average, i expected more from heineken
bottled. grainy malty aroma with a hint of rye. light brown with some caramel sweetness and a mild lightly dry finish and no surprises

Hints of roasted malts in the aroma. Redbrown color, light brown head that diminishes fast, no lace. Light sweet, light roasted, light bitter, hint of caramel. Medium body, little dry. Like a dunkel with few flavors.
beeter than rec heinekin bold sharp taste if you like dark beers i do i think this was one off the best back in 1993 my tast matured since then

Pours a dark red brown with a respectably dense, if slightly fizzy head.  Straight-up malty, corn syrup aroma, treacle at best, with undercurrents of a malt liquor (more corn).  Moderately sweet flavor, leaving notes of caramel and bread.  The palate holds together by a thread, being more thick than watery, though tempting fate with each sip.  Moderately tingling carbonation drives the first half of the bottle.  Seductive among mediocre beers--very drinkable, even if not high quality.

Aroma of burnt cookie dough, greets you after popping the cap.    Heineken takes a different direction with this dark lager.   Malty, roasted grains take center stage.    Fifty cents cheaper a six-pack in Jersey compared to its green brother.

I wanted to remind myself and reminisce about my college days and how sofisticated I thought I was drinking a dark beer.  Well here goes....Dark brown w/ hints of red and a tan head.  Malty sweet, carmelized aroma with perfumy, spicy hops.  Flavor is much the same as the aroma (good) but the dryish middle shows a sharp attack of carbonic acidity that competes with the returning, carmelized malt.  This is a pretty good swartz pils.

In the bottle. Brought back to me by Dee from Amsterdam. Reddish brown pour with a beige head. The sweetness abounds in this beer. Slightly chocolatey, mostly caramel. This might be a glucose tolerance test. Big departure from what my previous experience with Heineken has been. I like it. For the beeriphernalia collectors, the coasters are shaped like an oak leaf with orange and red fall colors.
Dark, dark brown, very still and only a quick appearance of a bubbly tan head.  Vague nutty aroma.  It’s a watery beer that struggles to get the smoky goodness you find better in Newcastle Brown.
Had a pleasant aroma, a bitter taste which I liked... I wasn’t dissapointed with this... a nice dark lager
Not a bad dark lager at all.  Had a crisp taste to it that I enjoyed.  Poured very dark with a creamy head to it.

This pours a very dark ruby with a low quality white head that dissipates almost immediately.  The aroma is mild and malty.  The taste is primarily malts with a lightly toasted hint.  The bitterness is light and the sweetness medium.  The mouthfeel is average and a bit syrupy.

Well, given that I find the standard Heineken Lager to be skunk like swill, this wasn’t too bad.  A sweet aroma was thankfully not apparent in the flavor.  Nice malty notes and fairly smooth.  Not much flavor but far better than it’s more popular counterpart in the line.
Bottled. Unexceptional - but by no means bad. Nice malty body with a smooth finish, a little thin but it is Heineken.
Huh, this is considered dark?  Obviously based on color alone.  Pours a darker brown color.  Aroma and flavor is lagery in a poor way; almost skunky.  Not much here.

Pours a dark, rubyish color with a thin white head.  Less stinging to the palate as a regular Heine.  Smoother mouthfeel than I expected, although still too weak and thin for a true dark lager.  A middle-of-the-road brew, not bad though (considering the source).

Faint aroma, slight nuttiness, malty sweet. Fizzy and bland flavor. slightly toasted, carmel taste. Seems to be a hollow shell of a brew. I got this for $7.68 for a 6-pack, and I can safely say I got ripped off. Another popular beer that doesn’t deliver.
Nothing special with this dark beer. It pours out tan, little or no head, watery, and not much aroma. It sort of reminds me of Miller HighLife with brown food coloring added to it.
I prefer the original lager, my first sip I expected a lot better but after that first beer i decided it was a good/decent dark beer.
better than the regular heineken (IMO), has a slight different taste from it, not like a dark should taste like.  very little aroma, thin as well...

heineken dark very light for a dark beer.  no aroma, has that "heineken: taste to it, and dosent tase like a dark beer at all. Not horrible but not even close to a good beer, yet when sitting next to a regular heineken it looks like a good option.
Ruby Coloring.  Small Head.  Little Aroma.  Malt.  Perhaps a bit of nut.  Little Skunky.  Was trying to stay hopeful but this one not so very good.

[bottle - Great European Beerfest 8, Sharp Edge Tavern - East Liberty, PA] Poured a deep brown color with a thin head. Not much of an aroma, but better than regular Heineken’s skunky smell. Slight malty taste, but very watery and thin. Not that impressive. Needs more body and flavor.

Bottle. pours a deep brown with very little head.aroma is almost nonexistant. i don’t know how they managed to take the flavor out of this, but they did. has an empty taste.  very unsatisfying dark beer.

Pours an almost opaque dark brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is pleasing and almost porter-like, rich with a strong malty nose, hints of coffee and nut. Taste is malty, but thin with a bitter aftertaste. Far better than regular Heineken, but overpriced for what it is ... like the green bottled variety. You’d be better off with an old ale from Scotland or Britain, in my opinion. The beer does gain some character as it warms, though. Not bad overall.
Very dark amber in color with a kind of peanut smell. Better than regular heineken, but still leaves a lot to be desired.

Nice enough looking beer , when poured into my gl;ass. Darkish amber..almost even garnet in colour..nice sized off white head..though it did not last.
The aroma is surprisingly malty and even touches of chocolate.
Again the flavour is much more malty and even has hints of chocolate( milk), small hop bit at the end.
KInda average on the palate..does tend towards wateryness near the end.
Not a bad dark lager at all..I would drink again, but hardly a classic
Bottled.  This had a malty aroma with slight alcohol notes.  The flavor is plain, but not offensive.  Better than regular Heineken.

Ruby-bronze body with mild carbonation and a soapy gray head that vanished quickly. Aroma of dark, fruity malts, raisins, and hay. Flavor is of burnt raisins, caramelized malts, and cola. Fizzy and thin palate. The burnt raisin quality gets tiring but this is better than most other macro darks.
It looks dark, but still tastes like a skunky Heini, maybe just a bit better.
Bottled from local bodega, umm Well it’s dark alright almost look like Coca cola.over all an avrage dark beer. I’d get it oce in a while

not a bad beer.  i’m a bit of a fan of dark beers though, so perhaps i’m biased.  i took my first sip of this a bit skeptically, thinking that heineken probably wouldn’t be able to do a dark beer well, but was fairly pleased with it.  after a six pack, i was even more pleased...
i like heineken but this stuff is not good. i had it on tap and i wasnt pleased. ill never buy it again.
Good dark, im a heineken fan anyway but this is very good, has an excellent flavour, colour is nice and just right on the carbonation.  Definately one to try if you havn’t done so already

I didn’t even know Heineken made a dark until I saw it in a local party store.  I don’t care for regular Heineken at all, but tried this anyway, being a dunkel fan.  This isn’t bad and it was fairly cheap.  It’s got a decent brownish-red body, fair aroma and good standard dark flavors of coffee & chocolate, without any skunkiness of a regular Heineken.
Not bad Roasty, chocolate, coffee undertone. Better than I expected. I like this better than their regular Heinie. This one matches my taste buds pretty well. I like this.
Better than the traditional Heineken, being darker and less watered down. Very filling and still has low flavor. It's good for a change once in a while.

This decent beer poured a dark brown color with a hint of red.  It was a clear (not cloudy), medium to light bodied brew.  The two finger head was dark tan and bubbly, but disappeared quickly.

It smelled great; I got hints of the classic caramel roasted malts and maybe a little sweetness as well.  My first thoughts were a pleasant fresh malty aroma.

The drink, like the aroma, was also a little sweet, but with also a subtle hint of hopy spice.  Although I can’t really put my finger on the beer’s aftertaste, I think it has a hint of chocolate.  It had a nice clean finish, even though the beer had a pretty strong carbonation.

I found this beer sitting in my refrigerator, apparently someone else had brought it over.  I personally would not buy it; it was however better than the Heineken Lager.  I would definitely recommend a Leinenkugels Red or even Sleeman Honey Brown Lager, which are both considered American dark brews.  A decent beer, but not something to spend your money on.
The taste is weak. I usually do not drink heineken but this isnt that bad. Not bad for a heineken but that doesnt say much

er.. smells ok, tastes like a weak dark coffee (??) flavored heineken.  alot of my friends like this, i just never could get into it.  especially for 8 bucks a 6, i can name about 40 other beers in the supermarket i would rather have than this.

The aroma is less than noteworthy. The appearance is a dark brown with a slightly orange tint in the light. The flavour is slightly metallic and while drinkable, not overly appealing. The palate is thin and tastes mass produced. Overall I expected to like this more than the lager since I was not a fan of the lager, but I like this one about the same.

Brown/orange color with a smaller light tan head. Looks more like a dark amber than a dark lager. Odd sort of caramel and lemon aroma. Light butterscotch, raw sugar with a pithy dry finish. Quite uneventfuo in all respects.

Initially not a fan of Heineken Lager, this special was met with skepticism from the get-go. But it did end up exceeding my expectations and I have to say that this easy-drinking dark lager is above average for being mass-produced.

Decent off-white head lasted average length over clear brown ale. Better than Heineken Lagar, but not by much.  There are much more malts, of course, and the skunky taste is not present.  The palate linger is still the same.  Costs too much for a Heineken.
Odd.  I dont know what they are going for here but its like a black and tan made with Budweiser and Killians.  It doesnt make for a real dark beer experience, rather light for that realm.
Pretty decent.  pretty good flavor, but took too long for the roastiness to peek out from behind a few slightly less desirable flavors.  I definitely like it better than regular Heineken.

Pretty good.  I enjoyed this one.  A little flat- it could definitely use more carbonation.  Looks like root beer.  No head at all.  Kind of a malty/caramel/cola flavor.  A little odd but good.  Hard to get excited about, but you could do a lot worse than this.

Smoky malt aroma. Little taste, less body. Let's just not. The new rules say I must write 75 characters about this. Really this is not foul, just something hardly worth a description. I'm not much for dark "international" lagers, but this is very much to dark lagers what an inoffensive macro would be to a blond lager.

Sparkling clear, ruby lager with a small, creamy, khaki-colored head. Very light milk chocolate in the aroma and flavor. Weak and watery. Well-balanced, but so is club soda. Light-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, watery finish.
it looks ok, but lacking taste big time!!! I was saying to mal3 that this brew has no taste!! ludicrous and faul ..

Reddish in color, with a smallwhiteish head.  Sweet aroma, I am thinking of carmel, and syrup.  Pretty sweet taste, sugary, camel, syrup.  A malty finish though.  Glad I can have tried it once, but nothing worth traveling to find.  Thanks Sue.

Not bad, but it was ice cold. I had to wait for it  to thaw, thought of making myself a nice eisbock.  Okay, better than the lager, kinda sweet, pretty much no head.  Bland brown, didn't shine red really when held up to light.
Overall, not much better than a regular Heineken. I too would take this over the original, but only out of desperation.
Overall not a bad brew from Heineken.  The beer has a nice spicy taste to it along with a brown sugar flavor.  I'd take over the original anyday.
Not that bad of a dark, and a whole lot better than the regular Heineken lager.

Two weeks ago I was drining the glory that is Girardin...now I am reduced to this.  Sigh, Vermont distribution.  Soon I won't even have bad macros left.  This was bottled, as if you care or it could possibly matter.  Pours dark reddish-brown, medium limp head.  Nose is soapy.  That's all I get.  Detergent.  Flavor lightly bitter & biscuity (burnt old Pillsbury, not your mama's fresh-from-scratch), corn-syrupy, and again with the soap.  No much finish.  Horrible.
After having the regular Heineken lager and liking it, the Special Dark was a great experience.  Somewhat sweet and smooth, it's a lot better than the standard lager.  Reminds me some of Newcastle.

Pours a dark ruby red, with a thin fizzy tan head. Aroma is minimal, but hints of chocolate and brown sugar are detected. Mouthfeel is thin and watery. It's slightly sweet and roasted. The finnish is a little dry. Decent beer. I'd totally drink this again. Seems like the more I drink the more I like. It's a million times better than the lager.
100 times better than their (in)famous lager.  Sweet but not overstated, smooth with some slight hops on the end.  Not a great beer, but certainly very drinkable.

MUCH better than the version we get in the states. I sampled this brew at the brewery in Holland and was very impressed. High carbonation, sweet malty taste. Much better than the bottled version available.
If I wanted to taste this shit I would go buy a case of horse jizz and a chocolate tootsie-pop.

Bottle.  Poured clear dark mahogany brown with medium tan head - sadly this was the highlight.  Aroma is weak, but features toasted malts, molasses and hoppy finish.  Flavor is dark roasted malts combined with an odd metallic sort of taste and a hop finish. Medium body and fair carbonation.  And to think, that there was a time in my life when I considered Heineken Dark to be one of the finest beers in the world.  Oh how young and naive I was...

Pours dark ruby brown with tiny beige head that dissipates entirely. Aroma is somewhat sweet and malty. Flavor is surprisingly good -- malt flavor is accompanied by crisp carbonated bite followed by slight aftertaste.  More going on here than I expected. Not bad.  Beats regular Heineken by several miles. I could drink a few more of these.

A pretty decent dark from a Macro-brew. Deep brown/red color with a slim tan head. A malty aroma with a hint of hops as well. Pretty smooth taste, well balanced. I wasn't expecting much, but was left somewhat impressed!

A dark brown body with a thin light brown head. The aroma is light caramel and some honey. The taste has some nutty caramel, but is light overall. Still, a decent beer. There is a little bit of roasted peanuts in this one.

This was much better than I expected. It was a nice brown/red color with a small head that faded to a lace. The smell was malty. The taste was malty as well with a little bit of hops at the end. The mouthfeel was very good. It was nice and meaty and had well rounded edges in accords to cabonation. I could make this a session beer easily.

This shit is gross.  It has some one dimensional chocolate malt flavor and thats why i gave it some points.  tastes like a bar of chocolate thats been sitting in a drawer for a few years. old ass shit.

"Dark" beers are out of popularity right now, which means there aren’t as many to choose from. Either way, THIS is one of the better darks ever made. Not overly heavy, but not a lager with food coloring added.
I think this one is getting a bad rap for being mass produced. Nice dark color with a light chocolaty head. Rich malty aroma. Flavor is simple, carmely maltieness with a touch of hops.
This is a great session beer for the Fall.  Minimal hop nose, but there is a clean malty body with hints of caramel and coffee.

This actually surprised me very much.  It poured a nice clear dark brown with an off-white head.  The taste was very malty, not too complex, but just the way I enjoy it.  Definitely recommended, and a great beer to enjoy any time or with any food.

I can't believe I am saying this, but for a beer brewed by Heineken this is a fairly decent beer. It poured a medium sized tan rocky head with fine-medium sized bubbles that mostly diminished. There was carbonation observed and it had an opaque body with a reddish-brown hue. The nose consisted of malt and caramel with a sweet brown flavor. The mouthfeel was smooth, slightly tingly, thin textured, and light-medium bodied. The downside is that it lacks in the flavor department.

This brew poured a medium sized head of light brown colored mostly lasting bubbles that left behind a fair lacing and a carbonated transparent brown colored body.  The aroma is a very nice "Brown" malt one with a fair amount of caramel in the nose.  Its is a suprisingly nice aroma.  The mouthfeel is smooth with a mild "Brown" character to it.  Again, suprisingly good.  The flavor is there, but a bit on the thin side and contains elements of dark caramel malt.  I am suprised to find myself going against the grain on this one as I think it is pretty decent!
Better than Heineken but funny that it is a dark beer. Not my favorite but has a little more character than Heineken.
Well, it LOOKS a little better than regular Heineken. Other than that, it's pretty much the same: Heineken with food coloring and possibly a tiny bit more malt.

Cola Brown, with minimal head. Chestnut aroma. Smoky sweet to start, then earthy and spicy. Lingering dry finish. Maybe I was a generous mood, but I thought this was surprisingly flavorful, considering how bland regular Heineken is.
Nothing "Special" about this dark beer.  Watery and non-unique.  Mass produced beer trying to simulate good dark beer.  Not fooling me.  Stay away.
This is a good beer. I don't mind heineken and this special dark was really a good solid beer.
Looks good from the color, but damn this is just as crappy  as the regular heineken beer.  I need to find me some PBR to wash this crap down!

This beer pours a dark amber color with a small head and moderate lacing on the glass.  The aroma is slightly sweet and interesting.  I really had decent hopes for this one because I thought that since it was dark, it would be decent - not sucky like normal Heineken.  I was wrong.  The taste was a little malty, but pretty crappy and enjoyable - the taste was very reminescent of normal Heineken with a bit more sweetness.  Didn't like it much.

This brew pours a dark ruby.  The tall light brown creamy head is mostly diminishing with no lacing.  The aroma is "Dunkelish" - oat cereal, and caramel with a floral hint.  The aroma is much more pronounced as the beer warms to cellar.  The flavor starts neutral with no acidity and finishes very caramel toned but remains balanced.  The light to medium palate is creamy, and lively with an astringent feel to the finish.  Much better than I anticipated.

This beer has almost no aroma.  Apperence is brown with a hint of red.  Pours a small head with large bubbles that disappears quickly with no lacing.  I guess this is classified as an American Dark because it it's a lager, but the look and taste is that of a Brown Ale.  Boring malt flavor with some hops in the finish.  Below-average dark.
Brown in color with a tan creamy head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is lightly toasted malt. Unremarkable yet not that bad. A little watery.
Reddish brown hue, decent initial head formation. Malty toasty aroma. Light fizzy palate, sweet malts, a little smoked, with a lightly bitter finish. Pretty bland.

A better brew than the original? As a bruin we may expect musc more than the original and so be more demanding. Enough said, it is not better. I think the orignal at least maintains faith with the intended style.
Much better than the regular Heineken lager. Roasted grain flavors predominant, slightly more bitter than I was expecting. Not very complex, but drinkable.

Aroma is fairly bland with some malt. Appearance is quite dark but not solid black . Flavor is kind of lagerish with some malt and chocolate detectable. This is a fairly good beer but nothing outstanding. Its pretty much in the same leauge as an Amber Bock or a Killians.
Dark ruby color with a small off-white head. The aroma and flavor included: slight alcohol, chocolate, maltiness. Too thin and watery. Otherwise, not a bad beer.
Not bad, not bad at all. A little watery thin but not watery though. Better than anything else from Heineken though.
I had this beer at a local chineese food place. I really enjoy the flavor with the food but i dont know how much i would like to drink a case of it.

Has a dark brown color with a good bit of carbonation and a skunked smell.  Taste is of roasted skunk and finishes skunked.  Overall I can't call it green-bottled-euro-skunk beer because it doesn't come in a green bottle.  It tastes the same, but roasted.

This has got to be the worst dark beer I have ever drank, in my entire life. I opened a bottle of this pig swill, and the first thing I
smelled was cheese. I swear to you, cheese. Stale, moldy, blue cheese aroma. Either I got a bad bottle, or this stuff is really
worse than I thought. Anyway, it was skunked as well, just like it's big brother. Poured out a muddy brown color, like high tide
at the beach during a Nor'easter. No head to speak of, unless you call a few lone bubbles rising from the bottom of the glass a
head. The taste was even worse. It tasted like gym socks marinated in stale beer, mopped up from behind the bar. Horrid, just
plain nasty tasting. I couldn't even choke 1/2 of this crap down. I poured out the rest of it, and washed my favorite pint glass
right away. I kid you not, gang, this beer is really bad.
I thought this was pretty good, and smooth for a Heineken product.  Above average.

Some hose-beast had my friend buy this for her, she drank two of them and left the other 4 in his custody, having never tried this one before I felt the need to try one, and let me say up-front I would have never drunk this had it not been free, and will not again (unless of course its free). The nose is somewhat sour and displeasing. Dark ruby/brown color that lacks depth, I can see clear through it. The head's decent, light tan. It tastes, just as it looks, like a watered down brown ale, it actually tastes alot like regular heineken with a slightly nutty flavour. In all fairness to Heineken, these beers had been around for a while and went through a few harsh temperature changes, but still I can't say that I would recommend this to anyone.

Decent dark beer if not a mass produced one.  Thin and dark with malt flavor and not much on the hop side of things.  Not as pleasant mouthfeel as I'd have hoped.  Slightly nutty flavors as well.  Far better than Regular Heineken.  That's not saying much.
I was looking forward to trying this beer once I found it locally.  Why I don't know.  This is basically an amber table beer and not a very good one at that.

A ruby hue with a short lived beige head. Sweet malt nose, no hops in the aroma, just very sweet syrupy smell. A tad thin very mild flavors, nothing jumps out at you just basic malty sweetness, not a bad beer but not good either. Just a plain sweet easy drinking brew.
For some reason the skunkiness is tolerable and sometimes even refreshing in their regular beer but is just wrong for this style.  The sweetness and odd skunk just clash.
Actually a good deal better than the original Heineken, though still nothing special, by a long stretch.  There are better darks out there...seek them out!

Overall a good solid product from Heineken. Don't see this around too often anymore. Good malty aroma, deep dark copper pour with a firm head and a little bit of lacing.  Above average malty flavor - stays strong throughout.
heineken did a descent job creating this dark. taste is similar to most other darks
I'm not sure if i got an old six pack of this but this stuff was putrid.  Tasted very malty, like Killian's but much worse.  Honestly, it made me want to vomit.
Better than the pale Heinekin. Still very light on the malt and hops........
I like this one alot better than the regular Heineken.  I like the fact that it is alot more full bodied and has a better balance of malt and hops.
Diminishing head but good lacing. Nice brown color with the slightest hint of redness. Strongly malty. With a little more hops this would be great.
Don't like it as much as I like the regular Heineken.  Still, it has a full bodied flavor and a nice aftertaste that I find missing from some of the other dark brews I've tried.
A bit more realistic caramel malt in this one, and am I detecting a bit of a sharpish hop presence? Or is that rice? I think it is better than the standard lager....
Almost completely oderless and flavorless.  Very bland ambur colored beer with coarse fizz and a rapidly fleeting head.  Certainly not worth the price.  Overall, a disapointing dark.
Cola-colored, short-lasting head, slight malt aroma that barely shows up in the taste. Not sure if I''d take this over a regular Heineken or not. Average at best.
Better than regular heineken, (big deal).  Has a nice tough of malt to it, but dont be fooled this is not a great beer.  Kind of like a cross between regular heineken and pepsi.
not bad. has a malty aroma and an almost caramel like aftertaste. goes good with a nice dinner.

Updated: Attractive ruby-tinged brown color, medium fading head.  Lacking effervescence, it eventually sits dead in the glass after the head dies.  Aroma is mostly caramelized/toffee but seemingly only a hint of melanoidin malt, perhaps a strong dose of caramel malt.  Light roast character (maybe carafa for coloring?).  Flavor seems initially sweet, but an herbal woody hop finish attempts to provide balance.  Overall poor integration of malt and hops, the beer finishes sickly and insipid.  Palate is medium, but feels chunky and weird rather than satisfying.  This may work better with food (something greasy: pizza, hamburgers, chili dogs) than as a stand alone drinker.

Sweet caramel malt aroma, bit of apple cider. Kind of weak. Medium high fizziness with watery body and light oiliness. Dark brown-red fake looking color. No head. Bit of sweetness to taste, but had some adjuncty flavors and an odd after. Like a sweet version of Heineken.
I like this much more than the regular heineken. It''s got a much better taste and is a little bit nutty. Best beer I''ve tried from germany yet.
This is overrated dark yuppie beer..........................................
brown with creamy tan head. Large bead. Carmel malt taste. A bit thin.......

Not much i can say about this beer..It was obviously maltier than the regular heineken..and because of this a lot of the adjuncty taste is diminished..resulting in a significantly better tasting beer...not at all offensive and easily poundable..but rather expensive
Not as bitter as most Heinekens.  Not very impressive.......................
I dont wont to talk about this brew much. I give it a: B-...................
Draft- This beer is surprisingly better tasting than their regular lager. Even though this is a EuroMegaBrew it still has a decent flavor and aroma.

I kinda like this, in a strange way.  It does have a malty, raisiny quality to it, it tastes like the color of the label... and thankfully it does not suffer from the skunkiness of its green bottled lager cousin.

Well, there's a taste here ... sulphured raisins? that I personally don't much care for, though I can understand the appeal.  Actually the best thing about this beer is Volgon's backanded Beatles tribute.

Regal ruby-red with a medium snall tan head. Doughy yeast, caramel and faint alcohol aroma. Very sticky sweet palate. Too sweet for me and I like sweet. Very sweet caramel and malty start.  Some bitter kicks in at the middle but can't compete with the sweet. I couldn't even finish the bottle on this one.
Not a heineken fan but this is better then their lager, doesnt have the bitter aftertaste that comes with most heineken

This is a very rare case where i prefer the regular heiny over the dark. I prefer the crisp bite of the regular Heiny, but the heiny Dark does have its merits. It has an intriguing brown, fruity taste almost that tickles the tongue. Its a good attempt by Heineken, but a modest Dark at best.
I like it much better than the regular Heineken, but it still has that sour/bitter aftertaste to it.  The only thing that this beer offers that regular heineken doesn't offer is a better aroma.

Sweet and weak, medium brown color, very little head with a standard aroma of a lager. Taste is far too sweet with no bitterness anywhere causing the sweetness to stay in the back of your throat. Better than regular heineken but no by much.
This beer is for the weak.  It is for suckers who like heineken and think they are drinking a dark beer.  Basically a bland dark lager, with slight notes of roastedness and dark food coloring.

Not very good for sure.  Like others in this site I detect the metalic aftertaste and the excessive carbonation.  Might be a little better than the green beer but not much.   A little better than the water they disguise as American beer though.
"fake" dark taste - chalky thin malts - tasted like they added some kind of "dark-stuff" ICK. little hops. slight metal taste.
thin, but very smooth, with none of the skunkiness that I expect from these guys.  Nice carmel flavors too.
I like the beer!  definately beeter than the regular Heineken.  I am partial to dark beers and this is a pretty good one.  Not great mind you, but pretty good.
I enjoyed this one more than I thought I would.  Good appearance but weak head.  Went down easy with good flavor and no bitterness.

It is alright.  I think that maybe I let it get a little warm.  It isn't bitter, though, and I really like the finish and aftertaste (kind of apple and carmel).  I am still partial to the skunk in the green bottle, no matter how smooth this one is.
I sort of liked this one.  Not bad.  A tad fizzy, though, but decent.  A pretty malty body.  Better than Lowenbrau Dark, which I thought was a touch bitter.
Had to force my way through it. Almost no flavor and the metallic aftertaste was unpleasant to say the least. Not bad looking, though.
I have tried all of Heineken's products, let me say that they are all bad...I hate how they call this 'American'
Not bad!  The bottle I had yielded no head and was a bit flat, but bubbled nicely.  Good flavor and less hoppy then the green bottle stuff.
This beer has a huge head.  I actually really liked it, which is surprising because their regular isnt my favorite.  I was definitely glad I gave it a try.
tastes alot like new castle which makes this a pretty good beer.............
better than their stuff in the green bottle, nothing impressive about it....
Umm, well, can't say they totally failed for trying. It's an okay dark beer, but not what I expected.

I wanted #100 to be special, but since I have tried just about everything I can get my hands on around here, I had to settle for this.  Not bad at all.  Right up there with Becks Dark as far as your mainstream darks go.

Huge head; tight bubbles... clear mahogany-red. Very smooth and easy to drink. I suppose they're after an "American Brown" with this attempt? Had a woodsy/burnt, slightly sweet flavor that wasn't too bad. Left the mouth dry, fairly clean aftertaste. Not too bad; and actually, I was expecting something less.
Taste was ok...looks like a dark, smells like a dark taste like bark...not sure what the problem is with their QC.
Sweet and clean. Hops only kick in towards the end. Decent macrobrew........
Metallic nose from the bottle and glass. Slight malted chocolate aroma. Clean lager front. Change of malted flavors midway. Finish ended slightly sweet throughout. Easy to drink, light session brew.

Not great, but better than Beck's Dark. Not much else to be said, really. Still weak for a dark beer, but at least some of the roasted flavor comes through. I'm surprised I liked it, considering how much I dislike regular Heineken.

blah. Just.....blah. I emailed heineken asking them who stole the good flavors out of their beer. Well, not really, but someone should. someone should also slap the crack pipe out of whoever's idea this was. Mediocre at best.
this isn't much better than the regular.  their is still too much hops in it.  way too bitter

When I was younger, so much younger than today,I thought this beer was perfect in every way. Now that times gone by my taste is much matured, It's weak and thin and tastes of soggy cardboard. Help me if you can in getting this down, Half a glass left, I don't want it around.
Help me if you can in getting this down, I'd feel really bad pouring it on the ground
You can't drink too many - it's frutiy and cloying and gets obnoxious after a while - but it's ok if you're on the road in an obscure place and a bottle of this seems the best you can do.
a little better then than lager, but thin for a dark beer...................
Should only be considered dark if you consider Red Dog a dark beer. Taken for what it's worth though, this is a pretty good smooth beer from the European Anhauser-Busch.

Heineken has always been a great beer.  
In my opinion, it's equivalent it not better than Guiness.
Dark in color only.  Mouthfeel is fairly thin.  Sweet with a pronounced apple aroma.  Some caramel notes, but no depth.  Not very satisfying.
Average. And i am tired so thats all i'll say...............................
goes on my list next to becks dark,the original flavor expect by the mass produced overseas guys.
Good body and respectable flavor, but sometimes skunked (needs to be shipped faster).
